oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hall. J.S. Hall House ID. Hall-Stakely Papers
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: J.S. Hall house. Hall-Stakely Papers, Box 24
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: E.J. Graves
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: House of J.S. Hall. 103(?) Oxford Street, Knoxville, TN. 1876. Bought of Andrew Jackson Campbell. Mrs. Frances (Hodgson) Burnett lived here. In the picture: Mr. and Mrs. J.S. Hall, Margaret Hall, Nurse, Wm. S. Hall (in baby carriage). Unidentified African American man at left in yard. Gas street light with eagle finial at right. E.J. Graves, Photographer.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Houses; Families; Group portraits; Gas street lamps;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8808. Please refer to Image Number if available and provide a brief description of the photograph.
